entry.title: Implement Permissive MTE
entry.content:
Permissive MTE will report the MTE crash but will try to continue

execution.



PermissiveMte::HandleCrash implements the handler for the MTE crash.

It disables MTE and then returns true so the execution can continue.

Also adds PartitionAllocPermissiveMte feature flag to enable

Permissive MTE.



Bug: chromium:1467915

entry.title: Don’t reposition to-be-snapped window as “floated”
entry.content:
This CL prevents FloatController from repositioning a to-be-snapped

window.

FloatController repositions a floated window when any size constraint is

updated (even when any constraint is not “changed”).

But if the window is in transitional snapped state (i.e., snap requested

but not applied yet), it is going to be snapped very soon so we don't

need to apply the float bounds policies. Otherwise, the bounds change

request may be queued and applied after it’s snapped.



BUG=b:279357161

TEST=ClientControlledStateTestClamshellAndTablet.SnapFloatedWindow



Change-Id: I54216b8d1a92fe5d5e7c1bd8a9d4d272e8b70eb9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4835570

entry.title: [BRP/clang-plugin] Adjust exclusions for raw_ptr bad cast detector
entry.content:
Exclude followings from `check-bad-raw-ptr-cast`.



- Casts in system header except "__bit/bit_cast.h"

- Casts in third_party except blink

- Casts in separate repositories (e.g. internal)

- Casts in scratch space

- Casts to const char/void pointers

- Implicit casts in comparison context

raw_ptr* raw_ptr;

void* void_ptr;

if (raw_ptr == void_ptr) {}

^~~~~~~ raw_ptr* is implicitly casted here

They have no risk to break BRP reference count.

- Implicit casts in function call, only inside template context

void f(void* p) {}

void f(int v) {}

template

void call_f(T t) { f(t); }

^ implicit cast may or may not happen here

It is hard to convert this into explicit cast.

- Implicit casts in allow-listed function calls



Bug: 1475895

Change-Id: Id3214bcbef626fafc4feec8742781581e421f51c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4812132

Commit-Queue: Mikihito Matsuura

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1192863}

entry.title: [Files]: Adds duration checks to recent source parameters.
entry.content:
Adds start and end times to parameters. If maximum duration is not set the end time is set to maximum possible time. If maximum duration is set, the end time is set to start time plus the maximum duration. Adds IsLate method to allow recent sources monitor if they still have time left to descend into subdirectories. In this CL there is no attempt made to terminate an already running directory scan.

entry.title: Media App: Enable Photos integration for Photos versions with suffixes
entry.content:
Photos began suffixing their version strings for dogfood releases with

-dogfood in Q1-Q2 2023. At this time, without warning, all ChromeOS

devices with dogfood version of Photos lost their Photos integration

hooks from the media app. Mark "invalid" version strings as a supported

version for the integration hooks as only dev or >6.12 versions of

Photos will be "invalid".

entry.title: Customize Chrome: Fix dialog positioning
entry.content:
This CL updates calculating how much space there is for the dialog to

use `getBoundingClientRect()`. `getBoundingClientRect()` gives values

relative to the viewport/window, while `offset*` values are relative

to the top of the document and therefore does not take into account

scroll position.

entry.title: Use PresetTextQueries to create editor menu chips.
entry.content:
Add PresetTextQueries as a helper struct to contain the id, name and

category of a preset text query, and use these to create

EditorMenuChipViews. May add more parts later, e.g. query description,

but this seems enough for now.



Currently, we just use placeholder PresetTextQueries created

in EditorMenuControllerImpl. Later, we'll replace these by the actual

entry.title: [fetch-later] Limit max amount of deferred requests per origin
entry.content:
The [spec][1] of the "Deferred fetching" algorithm sets the maximum

bytes of deferred requests (a fetchLater request) for a request URL

origin to 64 kilobytes.



This CL implements the restriction by surfacing a fetch's Request

body size from Request::ExtractBody() to

FetchRequestData::BufferByteLength(). The body size is extracted from

v8 value when `ExtractBody()` performs the body extraction.



Intentionally not to modify `Body` (Requests's base class) nor

`BodyStreamBuffer` (FetchRequestData::Buffer()'s return type), as they

are all widely used beyond a request, e.g. it can also be a response body.



[1]: https://whatpr.org/fetch/1647/53e4c3d...71fd383.html#deferred-fetching



Bug: 1465781

Change-Id: I075be5043f5658971d347729923f968b428bc7c1

entry.title: ChromeOS: TabManager: Explicitly Skip Discarded Tabs
entry.content:
It's possible for a tab to be discarded and then killed again in

LowMemoryKillImpl(). Usually the KillTab() call will just fail for the

tab that is already discarded, but this behavior is subtle and hard to

understand.



Discarded tabs should be explicitly skipped and logged as such so the

memory logs are more meaningful.



BUG=b:254164308

TEST=CQ, unit tests

entry.title: webview: Fix layout tests flaking
entry.content:
The layout tests rely on console logs. They are highly order dependent.

WebChromeClient#onConsoleMessage is actually async

but has just been passing for the most part because it

is normally quite fast.

But this can flake when the logs need to be deprioritised - especially

for slower emulators.



The console.logs for WebView are hidden behind a test specific

API so we can quite easily fix this by rather moving

these logs behind a javascript interface.



I'm leaving the default implementation in place for the rest of

console logs because this does of course make tests slower,

and we should only really need this for WebView specific permission

checks.



Test: bin/run_system_webview_shell_layout_test_apk

Bug: 1479002

entry.title: Reland "Remove SK_USE_LEGACY_BLUR_IMAGEFILTER staging flag"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 7a9d922349b9381e0bf8b21eddb9b9bd7f774713.



Reason for revert: msan crash is a red herring; suppressing the test,

landing this, and then fixing the crash cause in skia with another

round of rebaseline+re-enables afterwards.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Remove SK_USE_LEGACY_BLUR_IMAGEFILTER staging flag"

>

> This reverts commit 069d3d9db0b3093fec0edee412abfbdb9316f460.

>

> Reason for revert: Linux MSan failures; see https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20MSan%20Tests/42742/overview.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Remove SK_USE_LEGACY_BLUR_IMAGEFILTER staging flag

> >

> > With the removal of this flag, CPU-based blurs will now respect the

> > SkTileMode passed to the blur image filter. Both GPU and CPU blurs

> > will tend to have more optimal image sizes (smaller) when using

> > kDecal. kDecal should also use fewer renderpasses. There is a

> > temporary regression in image size and renderpasses for other tile

> > modes but this is a required step in the overall blur refactoring.

> >

> > It also fixes a bug where decal would be applied to the intersection

> > of both the filter region and primitive subregion when performing

> > blurs in SVGs. This is why there are larger changes to the

> > `effect-reference-subregion`: the blur is able to read the hidden color cells of the input image, some of which are red so the overall blur color shifts from green to brownish.

> >

> > Most viz pixel tests have benign updates. However, the blur_filter_with_clip test is meant to have clamped content. The SW

> > expected image had baked in the previous limitation of decal-only

> > blurs which is no longer the case. However, the software_renderer

> > compositor seems to be sizing images a little off so the clamp is only

> > applying to the top and left edges. Now the new expected image is

> > just half wrong :)

> >

> > Chromium is still relying on deprecated behavior for clamped blurs

> > where it doesn't specify the clamping geometry with the image filter.

> > This will require more changes but would likely get around the issue

> > with how the software_renderer prepares the images to be blurred.

> >

> > Numerous ash pixel tests had to be updated, but I couldn't spot any

> > meaningful differences in their content. My guess is that the widgets

> > and windows all had some amount of blur use, so this change touched

> > everywhere.

> >

> > Bug: b/294100597

> > Bug: b/40040586

> > Change-Id: I67d5840113e87cfbed1d3a2c4d624c8216991775

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4818347

entry.title: FSA: Fix shared lock types
entry.content:
The shared lock types were tied to FileSystemAccessFileHandleImpl

which existed per render frame host. Meaning each render frame host

would receive a different value for each type. So a siloed WFS opened on

one tab on a file would prevent another tab from opening a siloed WFS on

that same file. This is breaking existing behavior.



Now the shared lock types are tied to FileSystemAccessManagerImpl.

Letting them be shared between tabs.

entry.title: [Shortcut] Remove app_type from the icon_loader Key.
entry.content:
This CL removes the app_type from the icon_loader Key. Because in app

service, app type can be derived from app id, and app type is not adding

any extra value in the Key. In addition to this, removing the app type

can make it easier to reuse the icon loader for loading shortcut icons.



This CL adds a temperatory icon loading interface with the app type to

prevent making too much changes for all the clients that calls the icon

loading logic, will have follow up CL to remove the unused app type

argument and remove the extra interface.



This CL is in preparation for adding shortcut icon loading code. This CL

should have no functional change.

entry.title: Link Capturing: Handle link clicks with no referrer URL
entry.content:
Link clicks from inside sandboxed iframes (e.g. inside 'dynamic emails'

in gmail) do not have a referrer URL of any sort. We had previously

filtered links with no referrer out of link capturing, but this CL

removes that and allows them to be captured by apps.



Note that the original filtering was added to fix a bug with link

capturing from Google Drive into the Android Docs app (b/31043273). I

have manually verified that this still works correctly without the

original fix.

entry.content:
Blink has already had direct access to base histogram functions

and macros, so there is no need to have blink::HistogramTester

which had nothing special except that

- it provided only a subset of base::HistogramTester API;

- it didn't have the `location = FROM_HERE` parameter, which made

it difficult to debug test failures.

entry.title: Revert "CHECK that style and layout are not left dirty during lifecycle"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 1e1a64f32531250ff432ad72f21494b67a041bf4.



Reason for revert: Check (!frame_view.GetFrame() .GetDocument() ->NeedsLayoutTreeUpdateForThisDocument()) fails e.g. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac11-arm64-rel-tests/24387/overview



Original change's description:

> CHECK that style and layout are not left dirty during lifecycle

>

> `LocalFrameView::UpdateLifecyclePhasesInternal` is responsible for

> running the lifecycle and uses the following high-level pattern:

> while (true) {

> RunStyleAndLayoutLifecyclePhases();

>

> bool needs_to_repeat_lifecycle = RunStepA();

> if (needs_to_repeat_lifecycle) { continue; }

>

> bool needs_to_repeat_lifecycle = RunStepB();

> if (needs_to_repeat_lifecycle) { continue; }

> ...

> }

> Each step expects clean style and layout, and if a step dirties style

> or layout, it should re-start the lifecycle. This patch adds CHECKs for

> many of the lifecycle steps which ensures style and layout are not left

> dirty. These checks are added inside functions when possible, to

> provide more helpful crash stacks.

>

entry.title: [headless] Improve SingletonLock handling
entry.content:
Existing implementation used an early exit from

ChromeProcessSingleton::NotifyOtherProcessOrCreate() when

running in headless mode thus avoiding any inter process

communication. This approach has two problems:

* Stale SingletonLock file will not be deleted and will

prevent subsequent runs using the same user data dir.

* Headfull Chrome will create tabs in existing headless

Chrome if they happen to use the same user data dir.



This CL moves the logic to the existing process so that

it will drop the hand off requests if it runs in headless

mode or if the request is coming from a headless Chrome.



This way new headless Chrome process notifies existing

process if the SingletonLock and if there is no response,

does the appropriate cleanup the same way as the headful

Chrome.



Bug: 1463328

Change-Id: Ic6195c809e58774db199151486d184e65b4c4b54

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4844144

Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

Commit-Queue: Peter Kvitek

entry.title: CertVerifierServiceFactory: Speculative fix for mojo DCHECK if UpdateCRLSet called during shutdown
entry.content:
Mojo expects that the callback will be run unless the corresponding

binding has been closed. The CertVerifierServiceFactory binding is

essentially a singleton and will not be closed during shutdown, so the

ThreadPool can be shutdown while the Mojo methods could still be run.

entry.title: [2/3] Call CreateRequestHandler in PrefetchService unit tests
entry.content:
To expose crbug.com/1478875, as preparation for

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4840916.



crbug.com/1478875 hasn't been exposed because the

PrefetchService unit tests doesn't call

CreateRequestHandler().

For more realistic test coverage, this CL calls

CreateRequestHandler() for all successful

GetPrefetchToServe()s in PrefetchService unit tests.



This turns prefetch_successful_count 0 in some tests,

exposing crbug.com/1478875.

This will be fixed by

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4840916.



This also turns `EXPECT_TRUE(IsPrefetchServable())` to

`EXPECT_FALSE` in non-redirect tests as expected,

as PrefetchContainers are no longer servable

after CreateRequestHandler().

These changes will be reverted again by

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4819763

that makes `PrefetchContainers::IsPrefetchServable()` true

even after `CreateRequestHandler()`.



Bug: 1478875, 1449360

entry.title: window-splitting: Initial implementation for Window Splitting.
entry.content:
Implements the basic splitting logic with basic validity checks:

* Shows a preview of where the split window will go.

* Honors minimum size - if either source or target window would become too small after the split, we don't split.

* Avoids potentially resizing windows to become off screen - if the target window is partially off screen, we don't split.

* Defers to snapping and maximizing so that those take precedence.



There are bugs and QoL features that should be fixed before having users try it out:

* Splitting windows in non-normal window states.

* Adding dwell delay before activating.

* Adding ability to cancel after a dwell delay.



Bug: b/252550043

entry.title: ozone: Remove Pageflip firefly from keyboard blocklist
entry.content:
The Pageflip firefly shares its Product ID & Vendor ID with the Kinesis

KB800PB-BT keyboard & Filco Majestouch Convertible 2 keyboard. It should

be removed from the keyboard blocklist so that these devices aren't

prevented from identifying as keyboards. Project Imposter will be able to flag the Pageflip firefly as a non-keyboard, preventing it from identifying as a keyboard, despite not being in the keyboard blocklist.

entry.title: viz: Add optimize_for_wire_size flag to OverlayCandidateFactory
entry.content:
This CL makes explicit the optimizations in OverlayCandidateFactory that

minimize the serialization size of OverlayCandidates. Lacros takes

advantage of the smaller size to minimize traffic between lacros and

exo.



However, on Windows, we would like to make these optimizations optional

since do not have a cost associated with serializing OverlayCandidate.

Additionally, DComp only supports arbitrary transform-- if we optimized

by decomposing the SharedQuadState transform to gfx::OverlayTransform,

we'd just need to recompose it back to a gfx::Transform at some point.

entry.title: updater: change threading of COM proxy from STA to MTA.
entry.content:
This makes all COM callback objects free threaded. The outbound calls

are made on a task runner to avoid blocking the main sequence.



The COM callbacks are posted on system RPC threads but eventually they

get sequenced on the main sequence because each callback is bound to

the default sequence.



It's not possible for the state callbacks and

completion callbacks to be posted out of sequence because COM

invocations are blocking, and the sequencing of callbacks is

determined by the program execution flow.



Bug: 1479170

entry.title: CHECK that style and layout are not left dirty during lifecycle
entry.content:
`LocalFrameView::UpdateLifecyclePhasesInternal` is responsible for

running the lifecycle and uses the following high-level pattern:

while (true) {

RunStyleAndLayoutLifecyclePhases();



bool needs_to_repeat_lifecycle = RunStepA();

if (needs_to_repeat_lifecycle) { continue; }



bool needs_to_repeat_lifecycle = RunStepB();

if (needs_to_repeat_lifecycle) { continue; }

...

}

Each step expects clean style and layout, and if a step dirties style

or layout, it should re-start the lifecycle. This patch adds CHECKs for

many of the lifecycle steps which ensures style and layout are not left

dirty. These checks are added inside functions when possible, to

provide more helpful crash stacks.



Bug: 1473823

Change-Id: If5ad99117945aabda08bc59921fbef9e0d27e7d4

entry.title: Move batching logic to PrivateAggregationHost
entry.content:
Instead of requiring users of the mojo interface to perform their own

batching, we modify the implementation to automatically batch

contributions per mojo pipe, sending a report on pipe disconnection.

This simplifies the Shared Storage implementation and unblocks

crrev.com/c/4721635. Note that this requires callers to close their mojo

pipes on completion. The kMaxNumberOfContributions enforcement is also

moved to per-pipe instead of per-call, so that it remains applied to

each report.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=Replaced with PrivacySandbox.PrivateAggregation.Host.PipeResult in 08/2023.

entry.title: [wpt-metadata] Derive status allowlists from `wptrunner.wpttest`
entry.content:
`wdspec` subtests can apparently have the `ERROR` status (e.g.,

WebDriver connection closed abnormally [0]), which can incorrectly

block valid metadata. Fix `lint-wpt` so that valid statuses are derived

from the upstream's single source of truth, which should prevent future

inconsistencies (e.g., crbug.com/1446034).



[0]: https://luci-milo.appspot.com/ui/inv/build-8770763876869478481/test-results?q=external%2Fwpt%2Fwebdriver%2Ftests%2Fclassic%2Fperform_actions%2Fpointer_touch.py&sortby=&groupby=

entry.title: IndexedDB: add IndexedDBBucketContext::Delegate
entry.content:
This change introduces a delegate which provides main-sequence

functionality to IndexedDBBucketContext and other bucket-sequence

objects. The delegate is a struct that contains a number of

callbacks. The first three callbacks it contains are two callbacks

which were already being passed into IndexedDBBucketContext along

with a third which replaces

IndexedDBFactory::NotifyIndexedDBContentChanged, thus removing

some dependencies on IndexedDBFactory from classes that will live

on the bucket sequence.



Most of the change is simply plumbing as more classes now need to

reference IndexedDBBucketContext. However the net plumbing is

reduced as in many cases multiple parameters are reduced down to

a single IndexedDBBucketContext reference. The reference is a

raw_ref when the class in question is in the ownership chain of

the bucket context, and an IndexedDBBucketContextHandle when the

reference is meant to keep the backing store from shutting down.

(The lifetime semantics have not changed.)



Bug: 1474996

Change-Id: Ica75e6a4a8f1a9a22914cd1a7737023aa70614fd

entry.title: [tracing] Upload background tracing from database
entry.content:
Traces collected by BackgroundTracingManager will be

- compressed on a thread pool thread

- saved on disk in a database

- read from the database for upload through

BackgroundTracingMetricsProvider

This CL doesn't change upload policy (this is done in a follow-up),

so only traces pending upload are saved on disk.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[UMA.IndependentLog.AwBackgroundTracingMetricsProvider.FinalizeTime]=Replace by UMA.IndependentLog.BackgroundTracingMetricsProvider.FinalizeTime

entry.title: [iOS] Make sure the suggestions provider is set before using it
entry.content:
The Payments Bottom Sheet does not require suggestions from the

suggestions provider, as it gets its list of suggested credit

cards from the personal data manager instead. Unfortunately, it

still requires the suggestions provider to be properly set before

using it to perform the suggestion selection.



This CL adds code to the Payments Bottom Sheet's Mediator's

initializer to make sure the provider is properly set, which

happens within "onSuggestionsReady:provider:", which happens

as a result of querying suggestions. Apparently, this doesn't

always automatically happen on form load.

entry.title: Add some more debugging for navigation origin & process lock mismatch
entry.content:
There are 3 crash bugs that might be related, where we see:

- A BeginNavigation message from the renderer, where the initiator

origin doesn't match the process lock (see crbug.com/1474261#c2)

- A DidCommitProvisionalLoad message from the renderer for an

about:blank page, where the committed origin doesn't match the

process lock (see crbug.com/1470837#c2)

- A crash in RenderFrameImpl::BeginNavigation() which might be caused

by a recently added debugging CHECK for origin equality of

a synchronously committed about:blank document and its parent

(see crbug.com/1476614)



This CL adds some debugging to figure out the state of the world when

the crash happens, and also fixes some errors in previous CLs.



Bug: 1474261, 1470837, 1476614

entry.content:
Display loading visual instead of empty state while

destination-dialog-cros is still loading destinations and for a

minimum of 2 seconds to avoid the empty state appearing for a

moment then disappearing.



- Add loading spinner while destinations are loading and for a minimum

of two seconds before showing either empty state or printer list.

- Add function to determine when search-box and destinations-list should

be shown.

- Do not show empty state when loading spinner showing.

- Replace waitAfterNextRender with flush now that tests are configuring

a mock timer.

- Conditinally set mock timer for CrOS destination list tests.

completes.

entry.title: Remove WebAppToolbarButton.
entry.content:
This class served two purposes:

1) It allowed overriding the color of the Back and Reload button when

embedded in WebAppNavigationButtonContainer.

2) It allowed overriding the actual icons used for these buttons on

Windows, matching the OS native icons.



The first is no longer needed since https://crrev.com/c/4236152 made

sure the default colors are correct for these buttons.

The second is implemented by adding a "style" option to ReloadButton and

by explicitly setting the desired icon for the back button.



Bug: 1414432

Change-Id: I7b06ca612895e0c4972a08cd38f15544ee212108

entry.title: Reland "Deflake InterestGroupBrowserTest.AuctionNonceIsValid."
entry.content:
This reverts commit f687ede2dba3e34d34e9cb990141218528e5d60f.



Reason for revert: Dropping the extended maximum timeout available per buyer when !NDEBUG part of the original commit, since the other resolution should be sufficient to address the flakiness first observed. I'll follow up with the extended maximum timeout in a follow-on commit.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Deflake InterestGroupBrowserTest.AuctionNonceIsValid."

>

> This reverts commit 25089f1132708f5ba9afded4795e22033664bc5b.

>

> Reason for revert:

>

> Breaks 53 tests on https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/luci.chromium.ci/Mac13%20Tests%20%28dbg%29 with:

>

> mock_auction_process_manager.cc(184): Expected equality of these values:

> per_buyer_timeout.value()

> Which is: 1 s

> finalizer_receiver_set_.current_context()

> Which is: 0.5 s

>

>

> Original change's description:

> > Deflake InterestGroupBrowserTest.AuctionNonceIsValid.

> >

> > This test was occasionally failing with the error,

> > "Worklet error:

> > https://a.test:37987/interest_group/bidding_logic_use_wasm.js

> > execution of `generateBid` timed out."

> >

> > This changes the test to be closer to

> > InterestGroupBrowserTest.AuctionNonceOnComponentIsValid,

> > which wasn't experiencing flakes. It also extends the maximum timeout

> > available per buyer when !NDEBUG.

> >

> > Also changed all of the Nonce BrowserTests to use blink::TestInterestGroupBuilder.

> >

> > Fixed: 1474303

> > Change-Id: Ib5d984dabd1d80ebd141b8da4a89667cbedec502

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4803944

> > Commit-Queue: Orr Bernstein

> > Reviewed-by: Caleb Raitto

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1190133}

>

> Change-Id: Id679921a06f47c6f5bdbeb4ac7eb3a2017e10cd7

> No-Presubmit: true

entry.title: ntp: Add HCM support for customize icon for custom backgrounds.
entry.content:
Prior to this CL, the CSS selector for customizeIcon for custom

backgrounds had higher priority than the CSS selector for customizeIcon

for HCM mode. This means that in HCM mode, the CSS selector for custom

backgrounds was used, which resulted in an invisible icon.



This CL splits up the CSS selector for customizeIcon for custom

backgrounds to fix this issue.



Before:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4dRQvwdzuYFXq7G

After:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8dd2UCxNgdATyjT



Change-Id: I24bdccb537bfe63c9f6ae7e0ac0125db04856b5c

entry.title: Prevent tabs that have recently been audible from being frozen
entry.content:
There is a check that prevents recently audible tabs from being

discarded but this doesn't apply to freezing. This means that an

audible tab could be frozen if it has a freezing vote associated

with it and there's a small silence. This prevent that by protecting

recently audible tabs from freezing the same way it is done for

discarding.



Change-Id: Iea76307bbb557fd81022ea0b0bc00103154659f6

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1192682}

entry.title: [omnibox][actions] Remove description text and do not split in realbox
entry.content:
This CL clears the description/secondary text on the newly created

action suggestions. It also _conditionally_ prevents a bug found in

the realbox UI when new action suggestions are created. The feature

param OmniboxActionsUISimplificationIncludeRealbox defaults to true

so that we'll see the issue but users won't be exposed to it in

upcoming experiments.



Screenshots for main omnibox:

After: http://screen/3TNHD38pHVKGMA4
